intro: Agrostistachys longifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf agrostistachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often broader than the standard variety, giving it its varietal name. It produces small, greenish-white inflorescences that are clustered at the ends of the stems. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
